author: Anne Hokin
text: While you did compensate me, though I believe it should have been more, the listing of my items were terrible. Clearly, the person doing the listing never looked at the items. For example a sheared mink with brooches from J. Mendel was listed as a graphic print jacket not even mentioning it was fur. Said it was slightly worn, it was only worn twice and pristine. There were other items like this. Also items I didn’t own were listed as mine. A very poor job that I believe cost me money. Also there was no negotiation on the compensation. I believe I should have had the privilege of discussing this.

text:

I erroneously sent a $600+ order to my former apartment building in NYC.  The shipment is en route.  When asked what i should do, I was told I should work directly with my old building to get the package sent to my new address.
How about a shipping label to provide to them so that they can turn it right around and give it back to the UPS driver?
title: It did not seem like someone from the…

author: Eena
text: Firstly, RealReal doesn't believe in phone numbers.  They use WhatsApp to 'deal' with customer issues.  You are passed to a new person each time who has no clue what happened before them.   My return/refund process started Jan 23, and is still ongoing.  I have now dealt with 8 representatives, had it 'escalated' numerous times, and have had it 'discussed with the team' about 10 times.  And yet this group just can't seem to return/refund my account despite the clearly high level people working 24/7 on it.  I will not shop or recommend anyone ever shop here again.  And hey RealReal, I get that you don't really want to talk to people, but if it gets this far, and the person on WhatsApp is demanding a voice telephone call, the least you can is acknowledge it. Id also like to point out that WhatsApp has a call feature.
title: Returns are a nightmare

author: The RealReal Scam
text: My "Pristine" dress had giant hole. It was advertised as "with tags" and in "pristine condition". First time ordering from The RealReal. Had to fight to get a return label. The service rep swore I would be refunded for my entire purchase (including shipping to and from my house) but the RMA form shows that they did not refund the initial $12.95 shipping and are charging me $11.95 for return shipping. While speaking with the rep, I asked for proof in writing that I would be refunded for my entire purchase (including shipping) and would not be charged for return shipping, but he could not provide it. I do not trust this company at all and would NEVER purchase from the Real Real again. Time will tell if I will get a full refund for a "pristine" dress that was damaged beyond repair with a giant 5 inch hole I could get my hand through. So much for the "most trusted resource for authenticated shopping".  If you are reading this and are considering purchasing from The RealReal - run!!!
title: My "Pristine" dress had giant hole
